thread.title: Walker loses support among independents as approval rating drops
thread.title_full: Walker loses support among independents as approval rating drops

title: Walker loses support among independents as approval rating drops
text:
GOVERNOR SCOTT WALKER IS FACING A LOW APPROVAL RATING. 
AND AN UPHILL BATTLE IF HE CHOOSES TO RUN FOR ANOTHER 
TERM... 
ACCORDING TO NEW NUMBERS FROM A MARQUETTE LAW SCHOOL 
POLL... 
POLITICAL REPORTER JESSICA ARP HAS WHAT YOU NEED TO 
KNOW ABOUT THE NUMBERS FROM MILWAUKEE. 
just days after his exit from the 2016 race for president 
voters polled by the law school here gave govenror 
walker his lowest approval rating to date :47 
:27 NATwe interviewed 803 registered voters :29 
POLL DIRECTOR CHARLES FRANKLIN SAYS THOSE VOTERS. 
ARE STILL NOT LARGELY APPROVING OF GOVERNOR SCOTT 
WALKER'S WORK IN THE STATE... 
HIS APPROVAL RATING IS NOW DOWN TO 37 PERCENT IN THE 
SEPTEMBER POLL... 
WITH 59 PERCENT OF VOTERS DISAPPROVING. 
THAT'S DOWN FURTHER FROM HIS APPROVAL IN AUGUST OF 
39 PERCENT... 
the question i think is more one of whether he can 
reassemble the public support that he had to some 
extent among independents who lean republicans but 
especially among independents :55 those two groups 
were vital for him winning elections by 6 or 7 percentage 
points :02 
BUT ANOTHER ELECTION IS ALSO LOOKING LIKE A CHALLENGE 
FOR THE GOVERNOR. 
ONLY 35 PERCENT WANTED TO SEE WALKER RUN AGAIN... 
62 PERCENT DID NOT. 
BREAK THAT DOWN BY PARTY AND YOU'LL SEE 79 PERCENT 
OF REPUBLICANS AND 65 PERCENT OF THOSE WHO LEAN THAT 
WAY THINK HE SHOULD RUN AGAIN. 
WHICH IS ACTUALLY A DROP. 
that compares to 93 or 94 percent vote support among 
republicans and 86 percent among leaners :50 so clearly 
his numbers now are well below what they were at the 
time of the 2014 race :55 
the fallout from his presidential exit may also not 
have been what governor walker hoped for. 
in his speech he called on the gop field to join against 
frontrunner donald trump. 
:47 the marquette numbers show the majority of the 
governor's support instead went to trump, who now 
leads the gop field in wisconsin with 20 percent of 
the vote. 
at marquette university, jessica arp wisc news three. MADISON, Wis. - 
Gov. Scott Walker's approval rating is still falling even after his exit from the presidential race last week. Related Content
